thread.title: Firefighter pulls dog from burning home, performs CPR to save its life
thread.title_full: Firefighter pulls dog from burning home, performs CPR to save its life

author: Alex
title: Firefighter pulls dog from burning home, performs CPR to save its life
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
The dramatic moment when a firefighter pulled a lifeless dog from a burning apartment before reviving it with CPR was captured on camera. 2 
Andrew Klein, a first responder with the Santa Monica Fire Department in California, carried the dog named Nalu from the inferno and brought him to a nearby patch of grass where he immediately began performing mouth-to-mouth. Photographer Billy Fernando noticed the scene and snapped a series of incredible photographs. 3 
“As I was standing outside, I saw the firefighter, Mr. Klein, running toward the curbside grass area carrying something,” Fernando told The Dodo . 4 
“I didn’t know what it was at first, but then I realized that it was a pet who had been trapped in the fire. The dog was unconscious, limp and not moving at all.” 5 
“Just a minute after, [the firefighter] began performing CPR on the pet without any hesitation,” said Fernando, adding: “It was an awe-inspiring moment.” Advertisement
